title: Drawing, "Fountain Basin", 1650–75
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white laid paper
inscribed: Pen and brown ink, upper left: 49
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Two dolphins' tails form lateral edges of basin, their heads at the bottom center of the basin.  Two young male mermaids blowing horns ride upon the dolphins.  Two children, one holding sheet music, are standing before a woman in the center.  She raises a sail with her right hand and leans her left hand upon the head of a dolphin.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Fountain Basin", 1650–75.
1650–75. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1945-26-30.
